data.name: Universal Studio Japan
data.desc: Universal Studios, the world's third largest, is the second largest theme park in Japan and opened in March 2001. Universal Studios has a lot of attractions such as attractions and character stores with movie backgrounds. Especially, the attractions with colorful effects give the impression of being actually introduced into the movie. Because there are so many people, it is good for your mental health to enter immediately according to the opening hours. In addition to general admission tickets, there is also a priority ticket, which can be issued in short lines. Generally, there are Express 7, 5, and 3, but you can buy it considering the number of attractions you want to take. (Numbers vary depending on the season). Recently added Harry Potter Zone is especially popular.
data.time: Open time is flexible. Need to check homepage.
data.way: Take a train bound for Universal Studios Japan from JR Osaka Station's 1,2 platform and get off at JR Yunibasaru City Station. Alternatively, take the JR Osaka Ganjo Line train from JR Nishikujo Station to Universal Studios Japan and get off at JR Universal Bus Station.
data.fee: [Admission] Adult ¥ 6200, Child ¥ 4100. [Express] Express 7: ¥ 6,900 to ¥ 13,200. Express 4: ¥ 4,500 to ¥ 8,100

data.name: Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan
data.desc: It is the largest aquarium in the world. It is composed of 8 floors and the exhibition hall is 3-8 floors. It has a viewing system from the top to the bottom.
data.way: Get off at Osako Station on the Chuo Line.

data.name: Maishima Pottery Hall
data.desc: Ceramic art museum opened in artificial island of Osaka in 1998. There are a laboratory equipped with an electric wheel and a manual wheel, a glaze room, a display room, and an oyster kiln. You can try hand-made pottery or draw a picture. There are several courses available so you can choose the course you want.

data.name: Tempozan
data.desc: It is a shopping complex made by developing the triangle of the Ajigawa River estuary. In 1831, we dug deep into the river to make it big for Osaka, the center of trade.
data.way: Get off at Osako Station on the Chuo Line.

data.name: Naniwa Waku Shinbo Yokocho
data.desc: A food theme park that reproduces Osaka in the 1960s. Old-fashioned buildings give a vintage feel. The unique attractions such as cat shrines and statues are also fun. There are many restaurants selling famous food in Osaka.
data.way: Get off at Osako Station on the Chuo Line.

data.name: Ferris wheel
data.desc: It opened in 1997. The maximum height is 112.5m. On a clear day, you can see not only Osaka but also Kansai International Airport. It predicts the weather of the next day with the light at night. It is red when it is clear, green when it is cloudy, and blue when it is going to rain.
data.way: Get off at Osako Station on the Chuo Line.

data.name: Nanko
data.desc: Newly developed subcenter of Osaka Bay. High-rise buildings and parks are gathered together. It is also where the passenger ship arriving from Busan arrives.
data.fee: Get off at Cosmos Kuue Station on the Chuo Line.

data.name: Cruise ship Santa Maria
data.desc: A cruise ship made of the motif of sailboat Santa Maria in Columbus. It departs from the pier in front of Kaiyukan and goes round in order of Tenpozan, Universal Studio, Nanko and Tenpozan. It also operates a night cruise to admire the night view.
data.time: 11:00 to 17:00. [March, October, November]: 11:00 to 16:00. [December to February] 12:00 to 16:00. On time.
data.way: Get off at Osaka Station on the Chuo Line.
data.fee: [Day Cruise] ¥ 1,600. Elementary school students and under ¥ 800. [Night Cruise] 2650. Elementary school students and under ¥ 1300

data.name: Asia Pacific Trade Center ATC
data.desc: A large shopping center with the nickname of the world's largest import distribution base. It consists of three buildings. At Oz Park, you can enjoy relaxing time by watching the harbor, and concerts and other events are held frequently. ITM is rich in shops and attractions.
data.way: Get off at Toride-no-sen-mae Station on the New Tram Nanko Port Town Line.
